pullRequest.body:
+ Introduce a `SMul` instance for two `AddSubmonoid`s and provide lemmas

+ Introduce a `Mul` instance for `AddSubgroup`

+ Prove lemmas for the existing `Mul` instance on `AddSubmonoid`, which are generalized from corresponding `Submodule` lemmas

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

### PR summary [51cc9f4226](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/18096/commits/51cc9f4226be9b077c8f2e2b5739411c73709fc9)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ iSup_mul`
`+ mul`
`+ mul_iSup`
`+ mul_sup`
`+ mul_toAddSubmonoid`
`+ smul`
`+ smul_induction_on`
`+ smul_le`
`+ smul_le_smul`
`+ smul_mem_smul`
`+ sup_mul`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

:v: alreadydone can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11503491441/job/32020887598)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11503491441/job/32020887802)
Is `A := AddSubmonoid R` possible here? If so, then this instance probably creates diamonds

For `Semiring R` it's possible, but there's no diamond:
```
example {R} [Semiring R] : Mul.toSMul (AddSubmonoid R) = AddSubmonoid.smul := rfl
```
For NonUnital/NonAssocSemiring there's strangely no DistribSMul instance. For Semiring it goes through [DistribMulAction.toDistribSMul](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/GroupWithZero/Action/Defs.html#DistribMulAction.toDistribSMul) but for NonUnital/NonAssoc there's no MulAction.

I should definitely change this def to `protected def` and `scoped[Pointwise] attribute [instance]` like the others though ...
Oh sorry I misread, you're talking about `SMul (AddSubmonoid R) (AddSubmonoid (AddSubmonoid R))` ...

There's no existing `SMul (AddSubmonoid R) (AddSubmonoid (AddSubmonoid R))` instance, even for [CommRing R].
```
import Mathlib
open Pointwise
variable {R} [CommRing R]
#synth SMul (AddSubmonoid R) (AddSubmonoid <| AddSubmonoid R)
-- failed to synthesize AddZeroClass (AddSubmonoid R)
```
The reason is that there aren't many instances declared on [AddSubmonoid](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Group/Submonoid/Defs.html#AddSubmonoid). There's much more instances on Submodule, e.g. [Submodule.idemSemiring](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Operations.html#Submodule.idemSemiring), so we should probably worry more about that ...
Can you add the lemma `(M * N).toAddSubmonoid = M.toAddSubmonoid * N.toAddSubmonoid`?

The majority of this file doesn't insert a blank line between the def and the scoped instance declaration, but in the other file a blank line is always inserted. I think both are acceptable but a blank line seems to conform better to the usual style.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: SMul instance for AddSubmonoid and lemmas

source.title: refactor: generalize Mul of Submodule and SMul of Ideal on Submodule to noncommutative setting
